unicamp.description: We are a team of professionals who are passionate about teaching and helping others. We are here to help you succeed.

items.title: Showcase your work live
items.description: Launch your project to real users and impress potential employers with tangible results. No other academy really delivers on that.

items.title: Boost your portfolio
items.description: Add real-world projects to your LinkedIn and get noticed by a wider audience.

items.title: Join a curious and driven community
items.description: Surround yourself with people who inspire growth and creativity.

items.title: Collaborate with developers and UX designers students
items.description: Work in cross functional teams with other developers and designers.

items.title: Growth your network
items.description: Connect with like-minded people who inspire, support and help you to grow both professionally and personally.

items.title: Dedicated mentor
items.description: A person to share both the triumphs and challenges with, offering guidance and support throughout your courses.

items.title: Career-focused advice
items.description: Discuss your goals, map out your future, and get insider tips on breaking into the IT industry.

contact.heading: Still have questions?
contact.description: Please describe your case to receive the most accurate advice

questions.question: Are the courses really free?
questions.answer: Yes, they're 100% free if you meet the criteria for financing—no hidden fees, no surprises.

questions.question: What financing options are available for full-time working professionals?
questions.answer: We get it—juggling work and learning can be tricky. That's why we offer flexible financing options to fit your schedule and budget. Reach out, and we'll figure it out together.

questions.question: What are the requirements for the financing?
questions.answer:
To qualify for financing, you'll need to meet these criteria:
- Be between 18 and 65 years old
- Employed with a work contract or self-employed
- Hold higher education or an equivalent qualification
- Be a citizen of Lithuania or a foreigner with a residence permit in Lithuania
- Attendance: At least 80%

questions.question: Can I apply if I don't meet all the criteria?
questions.answer: Absolutely! Even if you don't meet every requirement, we're more interested in your potential. Go ahead and apply—we'll review your application to see if it's a good fit.

questions.question: How long do the courses last?
questions.answer: Most of our programs run for a few months (typically 3 to 6 months). Check the course details for the exact timeline—you'll know what to expect from the start.

questions.question: How are the courses conducted?
questions.answer: 100% online. Live sessions where you can ask your mentor questions in real time.

questions.question: What are my obligations after joining the courses?
questions.answer: Just dive in, participate, and stay committed. If there are extra requirements like internships, we'll spell everything out before you start.

questions.question: Will I receive a certificate?
questions.answer: Absolutely! You'll get a certificate to show off and celebrate your achievements once you've completed the course.

questions.question: I'm new to the IT field. Can I still join the courses?
questions.answer: Of course! Many of our courses are designed with beginners in mind. We've got your back as you take your first steps into the IT world.

questions.question: How much time should I dedicate to the courses?
questions.answer: How much time you'll need depends on the program and how fast you want to go. Courses usually happen 2–3 times a week, but your total time commitment will vary based on the program and your own pace. The good news? You can adjust your schedule to make it work for you, and we'll be here to help you stay on track.

questions.question: What do the final assessments look like?
questions.answer: Finals are all about showing what you've learned. They could be projects, quizzes, or hands-on tasks. Don't worry—we'll make sure you're ready.

questions.question: In what cases would I need to repay the full course price?
questions.answer: If you haven't completed the learning program or filled out the evaluation questionnaire within 5 working days after the program ends, you'll need to cover the program's cost. If you don't pass the final exam, 'Not Passed' will appear on your Unicamp certificate. But don't stress—you won't need to pay again. Just stay focused, keep up with the material, reach out to your mentor and all be fine;)

questions.question: What if I can't attend classes on some days?
questions.answer: No worries. Most sessions are recorded, so you can catch up later. For anything live, just let us know, and we'll help you stay on track.

questions.question: Can I access the learning materials after the course ends?
questions.answer: Yes, after the course ends, you will have access to all the learning materials for another 180 days. This will allow you to review key topics and reinforce the knowledge you've gained.
